Pre-Game Insights: India has dominated the home World Cup with three wins out of three games.
Bangladesh suffered its second consecutive defeat in the tournament after losing to New Zealand by seven wickets in Chennai.
The MCA Stadium in Pune has produced great batting tracks with an average score of 305.
Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan could miss the game in Pune due to a fitness issue as he was diagnosed with a quad tear.
The Rohit Sharma-led Team India has dominated every opponent so far in the tournament.
The batting has been in exquisite form, especially in the top order.
The bowling department has seemingly over-performed and firmly made the Men in Blue one of the top favourites for the title.
The only worry for the Indian team would be the batting of its lower-order players as they haven’t been tested in the tournament.
Bangladesh haven’t been able to build on their victorious start and has suffered two back-to-back defeats.
The Bangladeshi batting has been their biggest letdown so far as the top order has failed to fire.
The experienced duo of Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim have looked decent.
The bowling attack hasn’t looked potent and has been one of the key reasons behind their poor start.
